Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Hans R. Waldvogel in mp3 format. A powerful preacher who ministered as a pentecostal minister. He did not believe in sectarian groups but rather saw the Church as a whole who have the person of Christ in them.  Brother Waldvogel gleamed from many different men of God including A.B. Simpson.

His preaching was centred around the very person of Jesus Christ and the work of the Holy Spirit. He spoke much of the rest of the Lord in Christian work and experience and the Spirit-filled life.

audio_sermons.title: Desiring the Sincere Milk of the Word
audio_sermons.description: That is the great need: create desire within me; make me love you more, Jesus; make my soul to desire You.  And thereâ€™s a very simple way to do that.  The Bible tells us that â€œas newborn babesâ€ we have to grow.  â€œGrow in grace and in the knowledge of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ.â€  Who would like to see a baby remain a baby?  You wouldnâ€™t like that, would you?  Youâ€™d like to see them grow, get strong, get tall, become men and women.  And so my God has ordained that His children should grow, and grow into the full stature of the full measure of the manhood in Christ Jesus.

audio_sermons.title: Divine Healing
audio_sermons.description: â€œFaith cometh by hearing the word of God,â€ and God will always meet faith.  And what is faith?  Why, thatâ€™s the question: what is faith?  â€œI have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.â€  Iâ€™m often troubled when I pray for the sick.  Just recently I had that experience again.  I met some saintsâ€”not anybody thatâ€™s here; now, donâ€™t feel bad; Iâ€™m not pointing right at you, see: somebody elseâ€”but saints.  I was praying for the sick, and talking faith, and praying faith, and God was there.  And these saints talked unbelief. Youâ€™d be surprised how much unbelief is hanging on us.  The Bible talks about â€œthe sin that doth so easily beset us.â€  It sticks to us.  Die klebt uns an.  Grad wie die Kletten; das ist Unglaube.  Itâ€™s unbelief.  And youâ€™d be surprised what mountains of unbelief there are in the saints.  You donâ€™t find it out until the cat bites them, or a dog barks at them, or something else happens and they really have to believe God.  Why, then their faith is goneâ€”absolutely gone.

audio_sermons.title: Do this in remembrance of MeÂ”  Â“Forget not all His benefitsÂ”
audio_sermons.description: We call it GedÃ¤chtnismal in German.  And how many times weâ€™ve had wonderful meetings when we were reminded of â€œall His benefitsâ€: â€œWho forgiveth all thine iniquities, Who healeth all thy diseases.â€  Iâ€™m reminded now of a meeting in Stuttgart, in Zuffenhausen, where we had a communion service, and the Lord gave me a short message on that text from Psalm 103.  And people laid hold of it all over the place.  And I think before I got through preaching, many were filled with the Holy Ghost, and many got up, one by one, and testified that they had been healed of the most unbelievable diseases.  Cancer, and other terrible things fled before the memoryâ€”the remembranceâ€”â€œForget not all His benefits.â€  Forget not all that He has done for you on Calvaryâ€™s cross.  Iâ€™m so glad that Jesus Christ instituted this communion service for all of us.  And He told us to remember Him until He comes.  When He comes, we wonâ€™t need it anymore because then weâ€™ll have Him in person.  Then â€œwe shall look upon Him as He is,â€ and then we shall forever be united to Him.  And so, we love to be reminded of â€œall His benefits.â€

audio_sermons.title: Seeking God
audio_sermons.description: â€œEvery one that seeketh findeth.â€  Now, Jesus said that.  And of course, He has reference to finding Him, finding God.  â€œYe shall seek for Me, and ye shall find Me, in the day when ye shall seek for Me with your whole heart.â€  Finding God: why, thatâ€™s the very object of our salvationâ€”to be reconciled to God.  Salvation consists in knowing God.  How many, many people miss it!  How very, very few people in the world know God! You can tell it when you travel through the world and meet with works and ministers.  The great complaint is like it was by the prophet Jeremiah: the priests knew not the Lord.  How differently they would act and live and minister if they knew the Lord!  How different our conventions would turn out if those in charge knew the Lord!  But why donâ€™t we know Him?  Jesus says, â€œEvery one that seeketh findeth.â€  Findeth what?  Why, findeth God. Are we seeking God?  Are we really seeking God?  Then we shall find Him.  God says we shall find Him.  The very principle of faith is to start out with that knowledge: why, â€œGod is.â€  When you seek for something that you want very badly, youâ€™re not going to give up until you find that thing.

Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Hans R. Waldvogel in mp3 format. A powerful preacher who ministered as a pentecostal minister. He did not believe in sectarian groups but rather saw the Church as a whole who have the person of Christ in them.  Brother Waldvogel gleamed from many different men of God including A.B. Simpson.

His preaching was centred around the very person of Jesus Christ and the work of the Holy Spirit. He spoke much of the rest of the Lord in Christian work and experience and the Spirit-filled life.
